snippet: Officials hope to clear thousands of vehicles from the area, which has been cut off repeatedly when flames blocked the only road link to the rest of Canada.
abstract: Convoy of vehicles begins heading south on evacuation route through Fort McMurray, Alberta, after being stranded for days north of town by wildfires; officials hope to clear 15,000 cars and trucks from area over few days.
lead_paragraph: Officials hope to clear thousands of vehicles from the area, which has been cut off repeatedly when flames blocked the only road link to the rest of Canada.

headline.main: Convoys Inch South to Safety From Fort McMurray
headline.print_headline: For Evacuees   From Blaze, Safety Route Heads South
